item.title: Parents dine at no cost in Campus Dining Halls
item.description: Students with a residential meal plan (Unlimited,19 On Demand,15 On Demand,12 On Demand,5 On Demand), great news, your parents can dine with you at no cost at any campus dining hall from August 28, 2025 to December 22, 2025!
item.author: Students

item.title: Annual State Fire Inspections in Residential Buildings Begin September 3
item.description: The New York State Office of Fire Prevention and Control (OFPC) conducts annual building inspections of all college and universities across the state. Inspections of RPI residential buildings will begin on September 3, 2025, and are expected to take approximately three to four weeks.

item.title: Rensselyrics Fall Auditions | Sept. 9
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 9, 2025 8:00 PM - 10:30 PM - Join the Rensselyrics for our Fall 2025 auditions! The process is easy- just prepare a verse and a chorus of any song you feel confident in, and that you feel best shows off your voice. You can learn more about the process here and also sign up for a slot if you are interested. Don’t hesitate to reach out to us with any questions!

item.title: Counseling Center Announces Support Group for International Graduate Students
item.description: The Counseling Center invites International Graduate students to participate in a new drop-in therapeutic support group. Bi-weekly sessions begin on September 8th, 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. at the ISSS office. These meetings are free and confidential and offer the opportunity to connect with others, share common struggles, and learn skills for success.

item.title: Faculty Spotlight on Research & Impact webinar series-Rich Radke | Sept. 10
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 10, 2025 2:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Faculty Spotlight on Research & Impact - where Engineering Meets the World. Do you know how RPI Engineering faculty are shaping the future? In just 20 minutes, you’ll discover how their research is changing the world! Join us to learn how TED Talk meets research presented in PechaKucha style! Open to ALL (students, faculty, staff, alum, and all community members)

item.title: iEAR Presents: Visiting Critic Lane Relyea | Sept. 10
item.description: Visiting Critic Lane Relyea will give a lecture titled “Friendship, Community and Other Neoliberal Propaganda in Recent Art and Culture”. Lane Relyea is Associate Professor of Art Theory and Practice at Northwestern University. His essays and reviews have appeared in such magazines as Artforum, Afterall, Art in America, Flash Art, Frieze, Parkett, Modern Painters and Texte zur Kunst. Join us in the CBIS Auditorium at 5pm on Wednesday, September 10.
item.author: Community

item.title: “R for Python (and other…) Muggles!” RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 10 Sep, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group kicks off the Fall 2025 term with a review of R fundamentals useful for experienced R users but especially new users who may already have done data science on platforms such as Python. In this session we’ll focus on R data structures, subsetting, control structures, functions and vectorization. RPIrates is led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations with the Rensselaer FOCI and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. Pizza and salad starts at 5:30p

item.title: Webex: Recording to the Cloud and Storage Quota
item.description:
As the semester begins, Multimedia Services recommends that all community members review any Webex recordings stored in the cloud. Each user has an allotted quota of storage space, and exceeding that quota will disallow recording to the cloud. Any recordings which are no longer required for future viewing or archival purposes should be removed. For assistance with Webex recording management, please submit a Help Desk request.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
